p:
These data indicate three fairly distinctive dynamical eras:
1944–1950: Principally annual epidemics.
1950s–1960s: Regular, mainly biennial epidemic cycles, with intervening small annual peaks – incidence rates are markedly seasonal (Sect. 2.4).
1970s onwards: The vaccine era brought declining incidence, with increasing irregular, lower-amplitude epidemic cycles. By the end of the series shown in this figure, cases became very sporadic, with increasing levels of mis-notification of clinically identified cases [ 7].
